intro: Nothobartsia asperrima, commonly known as the hardy rock cress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Nothobartsia asperrima is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging garden conditions.
